15/*! \file */
16
17#include <config.h>
18
19#include <stdbool.h>
20
21#include <isc/platform.h>
22#include <isc/result.h>
23#include <isc/strerr.h>
24#include <isc/string.h>
25#include <isc/util.h>
26
27#include "errno2result.h"
28
29/*%
30 * Convert a POSIX errno value into an isc_result_t. The
31 * list of supported errno values is not complete; new users
32 * of this function should add any expected errors that are
33 * not already there.
34 */
35isc_result_t
36isc___errno2result(int posixerrno, bool dolog,
37 const char *file, unsigned int line)
38{
39 char strbuf[ISC_STRERRORSIZE];
40
41 switch (posixerrno) {
42 case ENOTDIR:
43 case ELOOP:
44 case EINVAL: /* XXX sometimes this is not for files */
45 case ENAMETOOLONG:
46 case EBADF:
47 return (ISC_R_INVALIDFILE);
48 case ENOENT:
49 return (ISC_R_FILENOTFOUND);
50 case EACCES:
51 case EPERM:
52 return (ISC_R_NOPERM);
53 case EEXIST:
54 return (ISC_R_FILEEXISTS);
55 case EIO:
56 return (ISC_R_IOERROR);
57 case ENOMEM:
58 return (ISC_R_NOMEMORY);
59 case ENFILE:
60 case EMFILE:
61 return (ISC_R_TOOMANYOPENFILES);
62#ifdef EDQUOT
63 case EDQUOT:
64 return (ISC_R_DISCQUOTA);
65#endif
66 case ENOSPC:
67 return (ISC_R_DISCFULL);
68#ifdef EOVERFLOW
69 case EOVERFLOW:
70 return (ISC_R_RANGE);
71#endif
72 case EPIPE:
73#ifdef ECONNRESET
74 case ECONNRESET:
75#endif
76#ifdef ECONNABORTED
77 case ECONNABORTED:
78#endif
79 return (ISC_R_CONNECTIONRESET);
80#ifdef ENOTCONN
81 case ENOTCONN:
82 return (ISC_R_NOTCONNECTED);
83#endif
84#ifdef ETIMEDOUT
85 case ETIMEDOUT:
86 return (ISC_R_TIMEDOUT);
87#endif
88#ifdef ENOBUFS
89 case ENOBUFS:
90 return (ISC_R_NORESOURCES);
91#endif
92#ifdef EAFNOSUPPORT
93 case EAFNOSUPPORT:
94 return (ISC_R_FAMILYNOSUPPORT);
95#endif
96#ifdef ENETDOWN
97 case ENETDOWN:
98 return (ISC_R_NETDOWN);
99#endif
100#ifdef EHOSTDOWN
101 case EHOSTDOWN:
102 return (ISC_R_HOSTDOWN);
103#endif
104#ifdef ENETUNREACH
105 case ENETUNREACH:
106 return (ISC_R_NETUNREACH);
107#endif
108#ifdef EHOSTUNREACH
109 case EHOSTUNREACH:
110 return (ISC_R_HOSTUNREACH);
111#endif
112#ifdef EADDRINUSE
113 case EADDRINUSE:
114 return (ISC_R_ADDRINUSE);
115#endif
116 case EADDRNOTAVAIL:
117 return (ISC_R_ADDRNOTAVAIL);
118 case ECONNREFUSED:
119 return (ISC_R_CONNREFUSED);
120 default:
121 if (dolog) {
122 strerror_r(posixerrno, strbuf, sizeof(strbuf));
123 UNEXPECTED_ERROR(file, line, "unable to convert errno "
124 "to isc_result: %d: %s",
125 posixerrno, strbuf);
126 }
127 /*
128 * XXXDCL would be nice if perhaps this function could
129 * return the system's error string, so the caller
130 * might have something more descriptive than "unexpected
131 * error" to log with.
132 */
133 return (ISC_R_UNEXPECTED);
134 }
135}
136
